abstract: Disappointing June home sales and new worries about banks dragged the Dow Jones industrial average down 283.10 points, or 2.43 percent, its worst loss in a month.
snippet: Disappointing June home sales and new worries about banks dragged the Dow Jones industrial average down 283.10 points, or 2.43 percent, its worst loss in a month.
lead_paragraph: A sharp drop in June home sales started the stock market off on a sour note Thursday and new worries about banks sent shares into a slide.

headline.main: Home Sales and Bank Worries Send Stocks Down
headline.print_headline: Home Sales Put Shares In a Tailspin
